title: Amendments to the Workmen's Compensation Ordinance No.19 of 1934 	(Chapter 139)
decision_details:
-In the policy statement of “Vistas of Prosperity and Splendour” under the heading of “a Culture of Working for the Country”, it has been stated that action would be taken to amend the Workmen's Compensation Ordinance No.19 of 1934 and  increase the compensation payment entitled to the employees in the event of a sudden accident. 

	Accordingly, a draft Bill has been prepared by the Legal Draftsman to amend 	the relevant provisions of the Workmen's Compensation Ordinance in order 	to increase the compensation to be paid to the employees injured due to a 	sudden  accident and it has been observed that the said draft has to be to further 	amended in view of the following reasons. 

    • to increase the fine of Rs 1000 that could be imposed in terms of the existing provisions in a situation where employers fail to submit the statement of compensation to the Commissioner for Worksmen's Compensation in respect of an accident caused to an employee under section 42 of the  the Workmen's Compensation Ordinance.
      
    • to amend the  Schedule IV of the  the Workmen's Compensation Ordinance which indicates the amount of compensations as follows to suit the current situation:
      
          i 	to increase the minimum monthly wage applicable for the 	payment of compensation from Rs. 0 to Rs 10,000/- which 	prevails from Rs. 0 to 2,500/- at present.

          ii	to revise the maximum monthly wage applicable for the 	payment of compensation from Rs. 100, 000/- upwards which 	prevails from Rs. 20,001/- upwards at present. 
          
          iii	to increase the amount of compensation paid in the event 	of death (on the basis of the wage) from Rs. 1,140,000/- 	to 2,000,000/- which prevails from Rs. 181,665/- to 550,000/- 	at present.
          
          iv	to increase the amount of compensation paid in a permanent 	total 	disablement (on the basis of the wage) from 	Rs.1,200,000 to Rs. 2,000,000/- which 	prevails from 	Rs.196,083.80 to Rs. 550,000/- at present.
          
          v	to increase the amount of compensation paid in a temporary 	disablement 	(on the basis of half-monthly wage) from Rs. 	5,000 to  Rs. 47,500/- which prevails from Rs. 1,320 to Rs. 	5,500/- at present.
          
    • to fulfill the task of  recovering the compensation to confiscate the property through the Fiscal/Registrar attached to the Office of the Commissioner for Workmen's Compensation, in order to expedite the process of recovery of compensation.
      
    • to introduce a new insurance scheme for workmen's compensation. 


	Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Labour to further amend the 	draft Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman so as to incorporate the above 	amendments as well, was approved by the Cabinet.
